titleStmt.title: William B. Winslow to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1068

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p:
W. B. WINSLOW, President
J. A. CRAWFORD, Cashier.
Office Southern Bank of Kentucky.
Carrollton, Feb 6th 1864
To His Excellency
T. E. Bramlette Esq., Governor of Ky
Dear Sir:

We have learned that one or more of our Bank Robbers are in Missouri and Cashier Crawford is about starting there in pursuit of them -- We therefore enclose his affidavit requesting that its authenticity maybe certified by you, and the robber demanded of the Executive Authority of that State, and that Mr. Crawford may be appointed agent to receive them --. Please return the papers to me at this place as soon as Convenient as the emergency of the case requires dispatch.
